item.title: Encrypt a file with GPG
item.description:
Tiny/Pico tip explaining how to encrypt a file using GPG to share it with one of your colleague or friend.

We start by checking if our friend key is aleady registered in our system using the following command:

gpg --list-public-keys

If it’s ok we just have to execute the following command to encrypt our file to share it securly to our friend:

gpg --encrypt --recipient your_friend@email.com secret_file_to_encrypt.txt

And voila that’s all.

item.title: Extraire et importer toutes ses clés GPG
item.description:
Export

Exporter toutes les clés publiques GPG dans un fichier base64:

gpg -a --export > /tmp/pub_gpg_keys.asc

Exporter toutes les clés privées:

gpg -a --export-secret-keys > /tmp/private_gpg_keys.asc

Exporter la trust database:

gpg --export-ownertrust > trust_gpg_db.txt

Import

Après avoir copié les fichiers sur une nouvelle machine et installé GPG, importer les clés:

gpg --import ./private_gpg_keys.asc
gpg --import ./pub_gpg_keys.asc
gpg --import-ownertrust ./trust_gpg_db.txt
gpg -K
gpg -k

Commandes utiles

  • Lister ses clés publiques: gpg --list-keys
